awd_titl_txt: Behavioral Capacities of Two Endangered Species of Sea      Turtle
awd_abstract_narration: All species of sea turtle are either endangered or threatened.                  Those concerned with the conservation of sea turtles are strongly               interested in the behavior of these animals.  Drs. Mellgren and                 Mann will conduct exploratory research on the behavioral                        capacities of hatchling green and hawksbill sea turtles that are                being "head-started" in a conservation project in Quintana Roo,                 Mexico.  Experiments on diet selection, learning, and species and               kin recognition will be carried out at the turtles' natal beach.                The research will be done in cooperation with Mexican biologists                involved in the conservation project.                                                                                                                           Information gained in this research will be important for                       understanding reptilian function in general and marine turtles in               particular.  Efforts to conserve sea turtles will benefit from a                better understanding of the basic processes governing their                     behavior.
